intro: Bunium alpinum subsp. macuca, commonly known as alpine fennel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The plant is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
